name: NIST 800-171 Rev 2
description: NIST Special Publication 800-171 provides recommended security requirements for protecting the confidentiality of Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) in nonfederal systems and organizations.
source: National Institute of Standards and Technology

requirements.title: Access Control
requirements.description: Limit system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, and devices.

children.title: Authorized Access Control
children.description: Limit system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, and devices (including other systems).

children.title: Transaction & Function Control
children.description: Limit system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute.

children.title: Control CUI Flow
children.description: Control the flow of CUI in accordance with approved authorizations.

children.title: Separation of Duties
children.description: Separate the duties of individuals to reduce the risk of malevolent activity without collusion.

children.title: Least Privilege
children.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, including for specific security functions and privileged accounts.

children.title: Non-Privileged Account Use
children.description: Use non-privileged accounts or roles when accessing nonsecurity functions.

children.title: Privileged Functions
children.description: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions and capture the execution of such functions in audit logs.

children.title: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
children.description: Limit unsuccessful logon attempts.

children.title: Privacy & Security Notices
children.description: Provide privacy and security notices consistent with applicable CUI rules.

children.title: Session Lock
children.description: Use session lock with pattern-hiding displays to prevent access and viewing of data after a period of inactivity.

children.title: Session Termination
children.description: Terminate (automatically) a user session after a defined condition.

children.title: Control Remote Access
children.description: Monitor and control remote access sessions.

children.title: Remote Access Confidentiality
children.description: Employ cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality of remote access sessions.

children.title: Remote Access Routing
children.description: Route remote access via managed access control points.

children.title: Privileged Remote Access
children.description: Authorize remote execution of privileged commands and remote access to security-relevant information.

children.title: Wireless Access Authorization
children.description: Authorize wireless access prior to allowing such connections.

children.title: Wireless Access Protection
children.description: Protect wireless access using authentication and encryption.

children.title: Mobile Device Connection
children.description: Control connection of mobile devices.

children.title: Encrypt CUI on Mobile
children.description: Encrypt CUI on mobile devices and mobile computing platforms.

children.title: External Connections
children.description: Verify and control/limit connections to and use of external systems.

children.title: Portable Storage Use
children.description: Limit use of portable storage devices on external systems.

children.title: Control Public Information
children.description: Control information posted or processed on publicly accessible systems.

requirements.title: Awareness and Training
requirements.description: Ensure that managers, systems administrators, and users of organizational systems are made aware of the security risks associated with their activities.

children.title: Security Awareness
children.description: Ensure that managers, systems administrators, and users of organizational systems are made aware of the security risks associated with their activities and of the applicable policies, standards, and procedures related to the security of those systems.

children.title: Security Training
children.description: Ensure that personnel are trained to carry out their assigned information security-related duties and responsibilities.

children.title: Insider Threat Awareness
children.description: Provide security awareness training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat.

requirements.title: Audit and Accountability
requirements.description: Create and retain system audit logs and records to the extent needed to enable the monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting of unlawful or unauthorized system activity.

children.title: System Auditing
children.description: Create and retain system audit logs and records to the extent needed to enable the monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting of unlawful or unauthorized system activity.

children.title: User Accountability
children.description: Ensure that the actions of individual system users can be uniquely traced to those users so they can be held accountable for their actions.

children.title: Audit Review
children.description: Review and update logged events.

children.title: Audit Failure Alerts
children.description: Alert in the event of an audit logging process failure.

children.title: Audit Review and Analysis
children.description: Correlate audit record review, analysis, and reporting processes for investigation and response to indications of unlawful, unauthorized, suspicious, or unusual activity.

children.title: Audit Reduction
children.description: Provide audit record reduction and report generation to support on-demand analysis and reporting.

children.title: Authoritative Time Source
children.description: Provide a system capability that compares and synchronizes internal system clocks with an authoritative source to generate time stamps for audit records.

children.title: Audit Protection
children.description: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

children.title: Audit Management
children.description: Limit management of audit logging functionality to a subset of privileged users.

requirements.title: Configuration Management
requirements.description: Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories of organizational systems throughout the respective system development life cycles.

children.title: Baseline Configuration
children.description: Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories of organizational systems (including hardware, software, firmware, and documentation) throughout the respective system development life cycles.

children.title: Security Configuration
children.description: Establish and enforce security configuration settings for information technology products employed in organizational systems.

children.title: System Change Control
children.description: Track, review, approve or disapprove, and log changes to organizational systems.

children.title: Security Impact Analysis
children.description: Analyze the security impact of changes prior to implementation.

children.title: Access Restrictions for Change
children.description: Define, document, approve, and enforce physical and logical access restrictions associated with changes to organizational systems.

children.title: Least Functionality
children.description: Employ the principle of least functionality by configuring organizational systems to provide only essential capabilities.

children.title: Nonessential Functionality
children.description: Restrict, disable, or prevent the use of nonessential programs, functions, ports, protocols, and services.

children.title: Application Execution Policy
children.description: Apply deny-by-exception (blacklisting) policy to prevent the use of unauthorized software or deny-all, permit-by-exception (whitelisting) policy to allow the execution of authorized software.

children.title: User-Installed Software
children.description: Control and monitor user-installed software.

requirements.title: Identification and Authentication
requirements.description: Identify system users, processes acting on behalf of users, and devices.

children.title: User Identification
children.description: Identify system users, processes acting on behalf of users, and devices.

children.title: User Authentication
children.description: Authenticate (or verify) the identities of users, processes, or devices, as a prerequisite to allowing access to organizational systems.

children.title: Multi-Factor Authentication
children.description: Use multifactor authentication for local and network access to privileged accounts and for network access to non-privileged accounts.

children.title: Replay-Resistant Authentication
children.description: Employ replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for network access to privileged and non-privileged accounts.

children.title: Identifier Reuse
children.description: Prevent reuse of identifiers for a defined period.

children.title: Identifier Disabling
children.description: Disable identifiers after a defined period of inactivity.

children.title: Password Complexity
children.description: Enforce a minimum password complexity and change of characters when new passwords are created.

children.title: Password Reuse
children.description: Prohibit password reuse for a specified number of generations.

children.title: Temporary Passwords
children.description: Allow temporary password use for system logons with an immediate change to a permanent password.

children.title: Cryptographic Password Protection
children.description: Store and transmit only cryptographically-protected passwords.

children.title: Obscure Authentication Feedback
children.description: Obscure feedback of authentication information.

requirements.title: Incident Response
requirements.description: Establish an operational incident-handling capability for organizational systems.

children.title: Incident Handling
children.description: Establish an operational incident-handling capability for organizational systems that includes preparation, detection, analysis, containment, recovery, and user response activities.

children.title: Incident Reporting
children.description: Track, document, and report incidents to designated officials and/or authorities both internal and external to the organization.

children.title: Incident Response Testing
children.description: Test the organizational incident response capability.

children.title: System Maintenance
children.description: Perform maintenance on organizational systems.

children.title: Maintenance Controls
children.description: Provide controls on the tools, techniques, mechanisms, and personnel used to conduct system maintenance.

children.title: Equipment Sanitization
children.description: Ensure equipment removed for off-site maintenance is sanitized of any CUI.

children.title: Media Inspection
children.description: Check media containing diagnostic and test programs for malicious code before the media are used in organizational systems.

children.title: Nonlocal Maintenance
children.description: Require multifactor authentication to establish nonlocal maintenance sessions via external network connections and terminate such connections when nonlocal maintenance is complete.

children.title: Maintenance Personnel
children.description: Supervise the maintenance activities of maintenance personnel without required access authorization.

requirements.title: Media Protection
requirements.description: Protect system media containing CUI, both paper and digital.

children.title: Media Protection
children.description: Protect (i.e., physically control and securely store) system media containing CUI, both paper and digital.

children.title: Media Access
children.description: Limit access to CUI on system media to authorized users.

children.title: Media Sanitization
children.description: Sanitize or destroy system media containing CUI before disposal or release for reuse.

children.title: Media Marking
children.description: Mark media with necessary CUI markings and distribution limitations.

children.title: Media Accountability
children.description: Control access to media containing CUI and maintain accountability for media during transport outside of controlled areas.

children.title: Portable Storage Encryption
children.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality of CUI stored on digital media during transport unless otherwise protected by alternative physical safeguards.

children.title: Removable Media
children.description: Control the use of removable media on system components.

children.title: Shared Media
children.description: Prohibit the use of portable storage devices when such devices have no identifiable owner.

children.title: CUI Backup Protection
children.description: Protect the confidentiality of backup CUI at storage locations.

requirements.title: Personnel Security
requirements.description: Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to organizational systems containing CUI.

children.title: Personnel Screening
children.description: Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to organizational systems containing CUI.

children.title: Personnel Actions
children.description: Ensure that organizational systems containing CUI are protected during and after personnel actions such as terminations and transfers.

requirements.title: Physical Protection
requirements.description: Limit physical access to organizational systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments to authorized individuals.

children.title: Physical Access
children.description: Limit physical access to organizational systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments to authorized individuals.

children.title: Facility Protection
children.description: Protect and monitor the physical facility and support infrastructure for organizational systems.

children.title: Escort Visitors
children.description: Escort visitors and monitor visitor activity.

children.title: Physical Access Logs
children.description: Maintain audit logs of physical access.

children.title: Physical Access Devices
children.description: Control and manage physical access devices.

children.title: Alternate Work Sites
children.description: Enforce safeguarding measures for CUI at alternate work sites.

requirements.title: Risk Assessment
requirements.description: Periodically assess the risk to organizational operations, organizational assets, and individuals, resulting from the operation of organizational systems.

children.title: Risk Assessment
children.description: Periodically assess the risk to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, or reputation), organizational assets, and individuals, resulting from the operation of organizational systems and the associated processing, storage, or transmission of CUI.

children.title: Vulnerability Scan
children.description: Scan for vulnerabilities in organizational systems and applications periodically and when new vulnerabilities affecting those systems and applications are identified.

children.title: Vulnerability Remediation
children.description: Remediate vulnerabilities in accordance with risk assessments.

requirements.title: Security Assessment
requirements.description: Periodically assess the security controls in organizational systems to determine if the controls are effective in their application.

children.title: Security Control Assessment
children.description: Periodically assess the security controls in organizational systems to determine if the controls are effective in their application.

children.title: Plan of Action
children.description: Develop and implement plans of action designed to correct deficiencies and reduce or eliminate vulnerabilities in organizational systems.

children.title: Continuous Monitoring
children.description: Monitor security controls on an ongoing basis to ensure the continued effectiveness of the controls.

children.title: System Security Plan
children.description: Develop, document, and periodically update system security plans that describe system boundaries, system environments of operation, how security requirements are implemented, and the relationships with or connections to other systems.

requirements.title: System and Communications Protection
requirements.description: Monitor, control, and protect communications at the external boundaries and key internal boundaries of organizational systems.

children.title: Boundary Protection
children.description: Monitor, control, and protect communications (i.e., information transmitted or received by organizational systems) at the external boundaries and key internal boundaries of organizational systems.

children.title: Security Engineering
children.description: Employ architectural designs, software development techniques, and systems engineering principles that promote effective information security within organizational systems.

children.title: Role Separation
children.description: Separate user functionality from system management functionality.

children.title: Shared Resources
children.description: Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources.

children.title: Public Access Subnetworks
children.description: Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are physically or logically separated from internal networks.

children.title: Network Communication by Exception
children.description: Deny network communications traffic by default and allow network communications traffic by exception (i.e., deny all, permit by exception).

children.title: Split Tunneling
children.description: Prevent remote devices from simultaneously establishing non-remote connections with organizational systems and communicating via some other connection to resources in external networks (i.e., split tunneling).

children.title: Transmission Confidentiality
children.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI during transmission unless otherwise protected by alternative physical safeguards.

children.title: Network Disconnect
children.description: Terminate network connections associated with communications sessions at the end of the sessions or after a defined period of inactivity.

children.title: Key Management
children.description: Establish and manage cryptographic keys for cryptography employed in organizational systems.

children.title: CUI Encryption
children.description: Employ FIPS-validated cryptography when used to protect the confidentiality of CUI.

children.title: Collaborative Device Control
children.description: Prohibit remote activation of collaborative computing devices and provide indication of devices in use to users present at the device.

children.title: Mobile Code
children.description: Control and monitor the use of mobile code.

children.title: Voice over IP
children.description: Control and monitor the use of Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) technologies.

children.title: Session Authenticity
children.description: Protect the authenticity of communications sessions.

children.title: Data at Rest
children.description: Protect the confidentiality of CUI at rest.

requirements.title: System and Information Integrity
requirements.description: Identify, report, and correct system flaws in a timely manner.

children.title: Flaw Remediation
children.description: Identify, report, and correct system flaws in a timely manner.

children.title: Malicious Code Protection
children.description: Provide protection from malicious code at designated locations within organizational systems.

children.title: Security Alerts
children.description: Monitor system security alerts and advisories and take action in response.

children.title: Malicious Code Updates
children.description: Update malicious code protection mechanisms when new releases are available.

children.title: System Scans
children.description: Perform periodic scans of organizational systems and real-time scans of files from external sources as files are downloaded, opened, or executed.

children.title: Inbound/Outbound Traffic
children.description: Monitor organizational systems, including inbound and outbound communications traffic, to detect attacks and indicators of potential attacks.

children.title: Unauthorized Use
children.description: Identify unauthorized use of organizational systems.
